events.name: Inaugural meetup: Introducing GDG Cloud Bauchi

venue.name: UpliftHub
venue.address_1: Adjacent Admin Block, Federal Polytechnic Bauchi

events.description:
• What we'll do
Welcome to GDG Cloud Bauchi!

Let's discuss how we can get the most out of this meetup by suggesting topics/programmes relevant to our community.

We will also have an Introduction to The Google Cloud Platform.

• What to bring

• Important to know

events.name: Cloud Next Extended - Bauchi

venue.name: UpliftHub
venue.address_1: Adjacent Admin Block, Federal Polytechnic Bauchi

events.description: Join us for this year's Next Extended event! We are excited to bring together the developer community to be a part of the Next '18 experience. This year, we have some exciting speakers, demos, and code labs planned. Join this meetup to get official Google training free of charge. Bring a laptop and get ready for the best Extended yet!

events.name: Google Cloud Storage

venue.name: UpliftHub
venue.address_1: Adjacent Admin Block, Federal Polytechnic Bauchi

events.description:
We will create and interact with Cloud Storage and conduct typical management tasks such as bucket creation, file transfers, Access Control List (ACL) permissions and Identity Access Management (IAM) configuration.

What to bring:-
(1) A laptop
(2) Power cable
(3) Backup internet

events.name: Cloud Study Jam

venue.name: UpliftHub
venue.address_1: Adjacent Admin Block, Federal Polytechnic Bauchi

events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console and a host of others!

What to bring to the event:
(1) A great energy and enthusiasm to learn and collaborate.
(2) Laptop -- Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.
(3) Laptop charger.
(4) Back-up internet.
Lastly
(5) A friend.

Looking forward to seeing you at the event!

events.name: Next ’19 Extended Bauchi
events.description: Join us for this year's Next Extended Event, where we'll connect with IT professionals, cloud enthusiasts and executives across industries while engaging in deeper technical content, hands-on learning, and more. Whether you’re an engineer, entrepreneur, developer, problem solver or somewhere in between — discover the endless opportunities to be inspired at Google Cloud Next ’19.

events.name: Bash Scripting 101
events.description:
Bash Scripting is an extremely useful and powerful part of system administration and development.... Bash is a Unix shell, which is a command line interface (CLI) for interacting with an operating system (OS). Any command that you can run from the command line can be used in a bash script.

During this meetup, we will learn how to write Bash Scripts and get acquainted with Variables, Loops, Conditions, Operations, Arrays and lots more....

Whats to come with:-
(1) Zest to learn
(2)Your Laptop
(3) Charger
(4) A backup internet
And
(5) That your enthusiastic friend.

See you there !

events.name: Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with Docker, Google Cloud Console and a host of others!

What to bring to the event:
(1) A great energy and enthusiasm to learn and collaborate.
(2) Laptop -- Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.
(3) Laptop charger.
(4) Back-up internet.
Lastly
(5) A friend.

Looking forward to seeing you at the event!

events.name: DevFest 2019
events.description: The Google Developers Group (GDG) DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about a wide range of technologies like web developments, mobile apps development, inclusion and diversity in tech, machine learning, cloud computing, codelabs, hackathons, fireside chats and panel sessions.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
Attending this meetup will avail you to learn or advance your knowledge on Android concepts, build a variety of apps and understand the general software development process for object-oriented applications using an IDE (integrated development environment) such as Android Studio. We will start with Hello World and work our way up to apps that schedule jobs, update settings, and use Android Architecture Components.

Come along with ...
(1) Laptop
(2) Power Cable
(3) Backup Internet
Lastly,
Your zeal to learn.

upcoming.name: Online Meetup on Getting Started with Machine Learning. How and Why?
